Description: Wheel made pottery saucer-shaped lamp with pinched nozzle. Archaic lamp, consisting of a small dish shape pinched to a point at one end for pouring. It has a small raised circular flat base and is undecorated with clay smears and slight wire-marks on bottom. Wheelmade, with slight wheelmarks on interior. Plain rim, slight knob at centre of floor. Finger-marks on outside. Hard red-brown-pinkish beige Nile silt fabric with drab brown surfaces; some limestone inclusions. Burnt spout through use.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Locally made archaic type lamp, probably early Ptolemaic in date (late 4th to early 3rd century BC), but may be earlier. Close Ptolemaic parallels are published by D.M. Bailey for the British Museum (Bailey 1975, British Museum Lamps I, Q515 and Q516). Many examples from Naukratis (McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock1987.381; City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol H843.a and H843.b; Bolton Museum 1886.31.6; British Museum Q515, GR 1886, 0401.1353). Parallels from late 4th to early 3rd century graves in the Hadra cemetery, Alexandria (Breccia 1912, pl.57, 129; Adriani 1934, pl.13, 2; 1940, pl.31, 2; 1952, pl.4, 2; Bailey 1977, 244). Late 4th or 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Blondé 1998, 324-5, no. 21), though this long lived form has a long history in Cyprus. Adriani, A. 1934, Municipalité d’Alexandrie, Annuaire du Musée Gréco-Romain Volume I (1932- 1933), Alexandria. Adriani, A. 1940, Municipalité d’Alexandrie, Annuaire du Musée Gréco-Romain, Volume II (1935- 1939), Alexandria. Adriani, A. 1952, Municipalité d’Alexandrie, Annuaire du Musée Gréco-Romain. Volume III (1940- 1950), Alexandria. Blondé, F. 1998. Lampes tournée Hellénistiques du Musée d’Alexandrie, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 307-35. Breccia, E. 1912. La necropolis de Sciatbi, Catalogue général des antiquités égyptiennes du Musée du Caire, L'imprimerie de l'Institut français d'archéologie orientale, Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KB.10) (Phase 3)
